org.goobi.production.model.bibliography.course

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.goobi.production.model.bibliography.course.Block

  • public class Block
extends Object
    The class Block is a bean class that represents an interval of time in the course of appearance of a newspaper within which it wasnâ€™t suspended. A Block instance handles one or more Issue objects.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

      The function getIndividualIssues() generates a list of IndividualIssue objects for a given day, each of them representing a stamping of one physically appeared issue.

      The function getIssue() returns an issue from the Block by the issueâ€™s heading, or null if the block doesnâ€™t contain an issue with that heading.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a List of IndividualIssue objects, each of them representing one physically appeared issue

      • isIdentifiedBy

        public boolean isIdentifiedBy(String variant)
        Can be used to find out whether the given variant string equals the variant assigned to this block in a NullPointerException-safe way.
        Parameters:
        variant - variant to compare against
        Returns:
        whether the given string is equals to the assigned variant

      • isMatch

        public boolean isMatch(org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
        The function isMatch() returns whether a given LocalDate comes within the limits of this block. Defaults to false if either the argument or one of the fields to compare against is null.
        Parameters:
        date - a LocalDate to examine
        Returns:
        whether the date is within the limits of this block

      • recalculateRegularityOfIssues

        public void recalculateRegularityOfIssues()
        The method recalculateRegularityOfIssues() recalculates for each Issue the daysOfWeek of its regular appearance within the interval of time of the Block. This is especially sensible to detect the underlying regularity after lots of issues whose existence is known have been added one by one as additions to the underlying issue(s).

      • removeIssue

        public boolean removeIssue(Issue issue)
        The function removeIssue() removes the specified Issue from this Block if it is present.
        Parameters:
        issue - Issue to be removed from the set
        Returns:
        true if the set was changed

      • setFirstAppearance

        public void setFirstAppearance(org.joda.time.LocalDate firstAppearance)
        The method setFirstAppearance() sets a LocalDate as day of first appearance for this Block.
        Parameters:
        firstAppearance - date of first appearance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the date would overlap with another block
